describe: The Bahamas is an archipelago consisting of 700 islands and over 2,000 rocks and cays, located in the Atlantic Ocean. Known for its stunning beaches, vibrant culture, and rich history, the Bahamas is a popular tourist destination offering a mix of relaxation and adventure.

cities.name: üèù Nassau
cities.geographical_location: Located on New Providence Island, Nassau is the capital and largest city of the Bahamas.
cities.climate: Nassau has a tropical savanna climate with warm temperatures year-round and a distinct wet season from May to October.
cities.famous_cuisine: Conch fritters, Bahama Mama, and Rock Lobsters.

cities.name: üèù Freeport
cities.geographical_location: Situated on Grand Bahama Island, Freeport is the second-largest city in the Bahamas.
cities.climate: Freeport experiences a tropical rainforest climate with hot, humid summers and mild winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Cracked conch, Peas n' Rice, and Johnny Cake.

cities.name: üèù George Town
cities.geographical_location: Located on Great Exuma Island, George Town is known for its beautiful beaches and clear waters.
cities.climate: George Town has a tropical climate with warm temperatures and a wet season from May to October.
cities.famous_cuisine: Exuma's fish stew, Coconut tart, and Guava duff.
popular_attractions: Exuma Cays Land and Sea Park
